name: Butler
description:
Butler helps you with three things:


- It let’s you search for local components to insert your current

position


- You can apply any local style to your current selection


- Go to any node in your document


Open the plugin, press TAB to switch commands or search for your desired component or style.


Caveats:


Users working with large documents may experience long loading times, this is due to how you’re allowed to fetch assets from the API.


Local assets only, meaning that unfortunately styles and components from your libraries won’t be collected. Also due to what is allowed to collect or not from the API, (and probably righteously so concerning security risks).


I’ve found a kind of similair plugin called Figma Walker made by Kazushi Kawamura,

you can find his plugins here: https://www.figma.com/@kawamurakazushi


Repository:

https://github.com/MikaelWeidenhielm/butler-figma-plugin
